content: How can I help you today?

I’ve been really stressed out lately. My wife and I are having a lot of problems, mostly because we don’t know how to help our son. He’s been acting out a lot, and it feels like everything at home is falling apart. I just don’t know what to do anymore.

That sounds like a really challenging time. It seems like you're carrying a lot on your shoulders, between your concerns for your son and the strain it's putting on your relationship with your wife. How have you been coping with all of this stress?

Honestly, I don't think I've been coping at all. I'm barely getting through the days. I can't focus at work, I don't really enjoy the things I used to, and it feels like everything is just piling up. I try to help, but nothing I do seems to make a difference.

It sounds overwhelming to feel like you're putting in effort but not seeing the impact you'd hoped for. Trying to juggle all of that while losing enjoyment in the things that used to bring you happiness must be incredibly draining. What would you say is the hardest part of all of this for you right now?

I think the hardest part is feeling like I’m failing my family. I want to help my son, but I don’t know how. My wife and I are so disconnected, and I hate that my daughter is being affected too. I feel stuck and like I’m just not enough for them right now.

It sounds like you deeply care about your family and are feeling the weight of wanting to support them while not knowing how to move forward. Feeling stuck and questioning whether you're enough must be incredibly painful. What has helped you make it through moments like this in the past—or even small things that have provided relief?

Honestly, I’m not sure. It feels like I’ve been stuck in this for so long that I can’t even think of a time when it was better. Maybe before everything with my son got so challenging, but even then, I don’t think I realized how good things were. Right now, nothing really feels like relief.

It must be tough to feel like you’ve been in this space for so long that it’s hard to even picture what things felt like before. The weight of it all sounds heavy, especially when nothing seems to bring relief right now. What do you think would need to happen to feel even a small sense of ease or progress?

I honestly don’t know. I guess if I felt like I was making some kind of difference with my son or if my wife and I could get back on the same page, maybe that would help. But right now, it feels like those things are so out of reach. I don’t even know where to start.

It sounds like reconnecting with your wife and feeling like you're able to support your son in a meaningful way would help ease some of the weight you're carrying. At the same time, it feels daunting to think about where to begin. It's understandable to feel stuck when the challenges seem so big. What steps, no matter how small, do you think might be within reach for you right now?

Take your time—it’s okay if this feels hard to answer. Sometimes even thinking about small steps can feel like too much when things feel overwhelming. If it helps, we can explore what might feel manageable together. Is there anything that feels slightly less heavy to start with?
I really don’t know. I suppose just talking about everything here is a start, even though I wasn’t sure if this would help. Maybe that’s the only step I can take right now.

Acknowledging your struggles and opening up here is no small step—it's a meaningful one. Taking time to reflect and share is a powerful way to start sorting through everything, even if you're unsure about where it might lead. How are you feeling now that you've started talking about it?

I guess I feel a little lighter, but also kind of unsure. It’s hard to believe that talking about it will actually lead to change, but I guess it’s something. I just feel like there’s still so much to figure out.

Feeling lighter yet unsure is completely understandable. There's still a lot on your plate, and it’s normal to wonder if talking can lead to change. Sometimes, even small steps forward—like opening up—plant the seeds for bigger shifts later on. What would make this process feel more helpful or meaningful for you right now?

I guess what would help is knowing there’s actually hope—something that shows me things can get better. I just don’t know how to rebuild everything, so maybe having some kind of plan or direction would feel like a start. I’m open to trying, even if I’m skeptical.

It sounds like you're yearning for a sense of hope and direction, even though it feels hard to see right now. The fact that you're open to trying, despite your doubts, really speaks to your care for your family and your willingness to move forward. Before we explore what a potential plan could look like, is there anything else you'd like to talk about or share?

It sounds like you're really trying to hold onto hope, even though everything feels uncertain right now. I can understand how important it must be for you to have a clearer direction. Taking small steps together, we can work toward that. What’s one area where you feel ready to start making sense of things—your relationship with your wife, your son’s challenges, or something for yourself?

It seems like you're balancing so much and longing for a way forward, even if it's just one step. Starting anywhere that feels important to you—whether that's focusing on your relationship with your wife, your son's needs, or even your own well-being—could help bring some clarity. Which area feels like a place you'd be willing to begin exploring?
